required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TUI 3D in Diagnosis of Placenta Accreta: Comparison With Gray-scale and Color Doppler Techniques
clinical_study.official_title: TUI 3D in Diagnosis of Placenta Accreta: Comparison With Gray-scale and Color Doppler Techniques

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the potential of the 3 D TUI view in diagnosis of morbidly adherent placenta in comparison to 2D grayscale, color Doppler and intraoperative findings.

detailed_description.textblock:
- This is a prospective study which will include 50 patients who will be selected from the outpatient and inpatient obstetric Ain Shams university maternity hospital.
- All patients will undergo the following :
1. History taking
2. Clinical examination.
3. For each patient, the whole placenta will be scanned in a systematic fashion using both 2D grayscale and 2D power Doppler ultrasound then displayed by 3D TUI to determine whether those patients suspected of having advanced invasive placentation.

primary_outcome.measure: Loss of the Retro Placental Sonolucent Zone by 2D Grayscale Ultrasonography
primary_outcome.description: 2D grayscale ultrasonography criteria of placenta accreta by Loss of the retro placental sonolucent zone in placenta previa with its lower edge covering the scar of previous cesarean section

primary_outcome.measure: Abnormal Placental Lacunae by 2D Grayscale Ultrasonography
primary_outcome.description: 2D grayscale ultrasonography criteria of placenta accreta by Abnormal placental lacunae in placenta previa with its lower edge covering the scar of previous cesarean section

secondary_outcome.measure: Crowded Vessels Over Peripheral Sub-placental Zone by Power Doppler Ultrasonography
secondary_outcome.description: Power Doppler ultrasonography criteria of Crowded vessels over peripheral sub-placental zone of in placenta previa with its lower edge covering the scar of previous cesarean section

secondary_outcome.measure: Abnormal Placental Lacunae by Power Doppler Ultrasonography
secondary_outcome.description: Power Doppler ultrasonography criteria by Abnormal placental lacunae in placenta previa with its lower edge covering the scar of previous cesarean section

secondary_outcome.measure: Crowded Vessels Over Peripheral Sub-placental Zone by 3D Tomographic Ultrasound Imaging (TUI)
secondary_outcome.description: the examiner can simultaneously display, on the monitor or on a hard copy, up to 24 preselected parallel cuts from a volume. The slices can be generated either along the initial or any other reconstructed plane of the region of interest (ROI) in intervals of 0.5 - to 5 mm segments. Slice thickness will be adjusted as necessary for each individual case. The most informative image among the multiple images will be displayed with the use of CrossXBeam, a postprocessing tool that allows one to enhance tissue and border differentiation, leading to sharper depiction of the tissue margins

secondary_outcome.measure: Abnormal Placental Lacunae by 3D Tomographic Ultrasound Imaging (TUI)
secondary_outcome.description: 3D tomographic ultrasound imaging (TUI) of placenta previa with its lower edge covering the scar of previous cesarean section the examiner can simultaneously display, on the monitor or on a hard copy, up to 24 preselected parallel cuts from a volume. The slices can be generated either along the initial or any other reconstructed plane of the region of interest (ROI) in intervals of 0.5 - to 5 mm segments. Slice thickness will be adjusted as necessary for each individual case. The most informative image among the multiple images will be displayed with the use of CrossXBeam, a postprocessing tool that allows one to enhance tissue and border differentiation, leading to sharper depiction of the tissue margins

study_pop.textblock:
- This is a prospective study which will include 50 patients who will be selected from the outpatient and inpatient obstetric Ain Shams university maternity hospital.
- All patients will undergo the following :
1. History taking
2. Clinical examination.
3. For each patient, the whole placenta will be scanned in a systematic fashion using both 2D grayscale and 2D power Doppler ultrasound then displayed by 3D TUI to determine whether those patients suspected of having advanced invasive placentation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. History of previous cesarean section or hysterotomy.
2. Placenta previa with its lower edge covering the scar of previous cesarean section
3. From 28 wks to Full term.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Multiple pregnancies.
2. Medical disorder as diabetes mellitus, hypertension.
3. Obese patients. BMI > 30
4. Intrauterine growth retardation.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Lecturer of Obstetrics and Gynaecology Faculty of Medicine, Ain Shams University

patient_data.ipd_description: TUI 3D in Diagnosis of Placenta Accreta: Comparison with Gray-scale and Color Doppler Techniques This is a prospective study which will include 50 patients who will be selected from the outpatient and inpatient obstetric Ain Shams university maternity hospital. Patient consent should be taken first.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: study that was performed at the Fetal Care Unit at Ain Shams University Maternity Hospital from August 2015 to march 2016. Fifty pregnant women In whom the transabdominal scan revealed evidence of anterior placenta previa were recruited from the the Fetal Care Unit who fulfilled the inclusion criteria.

group.title: Women With Placenta Previa Who Had Easily Placenta Delivery
group.description: This is a prospective study which will include 50 patients who will be selected from the outpatient and inpatient obstetric Ain Shams university maternity hospital. • All patients will undergo the following : For each patient, the whole placenta will be scanned in a systematic fashion using both 2D grayscale and 2D power Doppler ultrasound then displayed by 3D TUI to determine whether those patients suspected of having advanced invasive placentation. Intraoperative: Delivery of the fetus through the placenta. 15 minutes for spontaneous separation of the placenta were waited, if easily separated hot packs then rapid closure of the uterus in 2 layers. 30 Women with placenta previa who had easily placenta delivery

group.title: Women With Placenta Previa Who Had Difficult Placenta Delivery
group.description: This is a prospective study which will include 50 patients who will be selected from the outpatient and inpatient obstetric Ain Shams university maternity hospital. • All patients will undergo the following : For each patient, the whole placenta will be scanned in a systematic fashion using both 2D grayscale and 2D power Doppler ultrasound then displayed by 3D TUI to determine whether those patients suspected of having advanced invasive placentation. Intraoperative: Delivery of the fetus through the placenta. 15 minutes for spontaneous separation of the placenta were waited, if easily separated hot packs then rapid closure of the uterus in 2 layers. When not separated easily manual removal was done, with uterotonics, together with uterine massage. 20 Women with placenta previa who had difficult placenta delivery

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Crowded Vessels Over Peripheral Sub-placental Zone by 3D Tomographic Ultrasound Imaging (TUI)
outcome.description: the examiner can simultaneously display, on the monitor or on a hard copy, up to 24 preselected parallel cuts from a volume. The slices can be generated either along the initial or any other reconstructed plane of the region of interest (ROI) in intervals of 0.5 - to 5 mm segments. Slice thickness will be adjusted as necessary for each individual case. The most informative image among the multiple images will be displayed with the use of CrossXBeam, a postprocessing tool that allows one to enhance tissue and border differentiation, leading to sharper depiction of the tissue margins

reported_events.time_frame: from 28 weeks to 36 weeks of gestation
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events were assessed during ultrasound examination

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
